definition: animal hide/leather/to reform/to remove/to expel (from office)

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: What these reformers then did,they said,"Wait a minute.
The reformer is Ichiro Ozawa. Calling him controversial is putting it mildly.
sentences.chinese: 改革者是小澤一郎，稱他有爭議還算委婉的說法。

sentences.english: So the health reformers offer subsidies.
sentences.chinese: 因此改革者便提供津貼。

sentences.english: The reformers met these arguments by adopting the following compromise.
sentences.chinese: 改革者綜合她們的意見，作了以下妥協。

sentences.english: Netscapes At one point, if you went on Netscapes on page, it listed the biggest innovators on the Internet.
sentences.chinese: 你可能過去曾上過，它曾列出了因特網最大的改革者。

sentences.english: She has the reputation of a reformer and is disarmingly frank.
sentences.chinese: 據說她是一個改革者，而且坦誠得毫不設防。

sentences.english: There are a few important differences between the time notion of school-teachers and educational reformers.
sentences.chinese: 教師與教育改革者的時間觀念存在差異。

sentences.english: To be exact, he is a gradualist reformer.
sentences.chinese: 準確地說，他是一位漸進的改革者。
他是不屈不撓的改革者的典型。

sentences.english: The teachers’ unions have an impressive record of terminating reformers.
sentences.chinese: 教師工會對付改革者是出了名的心狠手辣。

sentences.english: Reform "can degenerate into political payback" by the reformers.
sentences.chinese: 改革“可能退化爲由改革者發起的政治報復”。

definition: reformism (i.e. favoring gradual change as opposed to revolution)
(idiom) to continue in the same old rut/diehard conservative attitudes
